summary: Poutine is a popular Canadian dish from Quebec made of fries, cheese curds, and gravy. It started in the 1950s, but no one is sure who invented it. At first, some people made fun of it, but now it's seen as a special part of Quebec's culture. Poutine is now famous across Canada and even in other countries. Many cities have poutine festivals, and some people think it should be Canada's national dish. You can find many different kinds of poutine, showing how popular and versatile this dish has become.
title: Poutine
